headline: Compared to Estimates, Republic Services (RSG) Q2 Earnings: A Look at Key Metrics
summary: While the top- and bottom-line numbers for Republic Services (RSG) give a sense of how the business performed in the quarter ended June 2025, it could be worth looking at how some of its key metrics compare to Wall Street estimates and year-ago values.

headline: Republic Services (NYSE:RSG) Reports Sales Below Analyst Estimates In Q2 Earnings
summary: Waste management company Republic Services (NYSE:RSG) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025 as sales rose 4.6% year on year to $4.24 billion. The company’s full-year revenue guidance of $16.71 billion at the midpoint came in 0.9% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.77 per share was 0.7% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Republic Services (RSG) Q2 Earnings Surpass Estimates
summary: Republic Services (RSG) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +1.14% and -0.75%, respectively, for the quarter ended June 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Republic Services: Q2 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The Phoenix-based company said it had net income of $1.75 per share. Earnings, adjusted for restructuring costs and asset impairment costs, were $1.77 per share. The results topped Wall Street expectations.

raw.headline: Republic Services: Q2 Earnings Snapshot

headline: Republic Services, Inc. Reports Second Quarter 2025 Results
summary: Republic Services, Inc. (NYSE: RSG) today reported net income of $550 million, or $1.75 per diluted share, for the three months ended June 30, 2025, versus $512 million, or $1.62 per diluted share, for the comparable 2024 period. Excluding certain expenses and other items, on an adjusted basis, net income for the three months ended June 30, 2025, was $556 million, or $1.77 per diluted share, versus $509 million, or $1.61 per diluted share, for the comparable 2024 period.

headline: Ameresco and Republic Services Launch Another Renewable Natural Gas Facility at Lee County Landfill
summary: FRAMINGHAM, Mass. & DIXON, Ill., July 29, 2025--Ameresco, Inc., (NYSE: AMRC), a leading energy solutions provider dedicated to helping customers navigate the energy transition, today announced that its latest renewable natural gas (RNG) facility through its partnership with Republic Services (NYSE: RSG), a leader in the environmental services industry, has achieved commercial operation of a renewable gas facility located at the County Landfill in Dixon, Illinois.
